definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: I have been moving toward a paperless office for two reasons.
sentences.chinese: 我现在已经步入无纸化办公，原因有两个。

sentences.english: The ubiquity of computers was supposed to bring us paperless offices.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的普及无疑会给我们带来无纸化的办公。

sentences.english: Your support to a paperless environment would be appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 本会对阁下支持无纸化环境感激不尽。

sentences.english: The film characteristics is the biggest film is pure hand-painted paperless production completed.
sentences.chinese: 该片最大的特色是全片是纯手绘无纸化制作完成的。

sentences.english: Withthe rapidly development of electronic technology, the paperless office is basically realized.
sentences.chinese: 随着科技的高速发展，无纸化办公室基本实现了。

sentences.english: Last year Breedlove decided to go paperless.
sentences.chinese: 去年，布瑞列夫决定开始无纸化办公。

definition: to facilitate/expedite/make convenient and fast/speed up
informatization (the Information Age analog of industrialization)
paper/hard copy/printed (as opposed to electronically displayed)

pinyin: dian4 zi3 shu4 ju4 jiao1 huan4

definition: (international trade) documentation (e.g. a bill of lading)
